```{r}
# output: FALSE
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(broom)
```

```{r}
expression_data <- read_tsv('../data/augmented_meta_gene_table.tsv.gz')
```

```{r}
meta_cols <- c('Sample',
               'Gender',
               'Race',
               'Smoker',
               'Age',
               'BMI')


pca_data <- 
  expression_data |> 
  select(all_of(meta_cols), 
         gene,
         log2_Lesion, 
         log2_Perilesion) |> 
  pivot_longer(c(log2_Lesion, log2_Perilesion),
               names_to = 'Tissue_type',
               values_to = 'log2_expr') |> 
  mutate(Tissue_type = if_else(Tissue_type == 'log2_Lesion', 
                               'Lesion', 
                               'Perilesion')) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = gene, values_from = log2_expr) |> 
  mutate(Sample = 
           if_else(Tissue_type == 'Lesion', 
                   paste0(Sample, 'L'),
                   paste0(Sample, 'P')
                   )
         )


pca_fit <- 
  pca_data |> 
  select(starts_with('ENSG')) |> 
# To standarize the data. I don't think it make the biggest difference. Also, i guess, it would 
#  scale() |> 
  prcomp()


PCA_plot <- pca_fit |> 
  augment(pca_data) |> 
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, 
             .fittedPC2, 
             color = Tissue_type,
             label = Sample)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5) +
  labs(title = 'PCA of RNA-seq Data by Tissue Type',
       x = 'PC1',
       y = 'PC2',
       color = 'Tissue type') +
  # Adds sample labels
  geom_text_repel(size = 2.5,
                  min.segment.length = 0,
                  segment.linetype = 4) + 
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = 
          element_text(hjust = 0.5,
                       vjust = 2,
                       face = 'bold'),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
        ) 

ggsave("PCA.png", PCA_plot, path = "../pictures") 

  PCA_plot
```

```{r}

# Does make that much sense to look at, i suppose

pca_data <- 
  pca_data |> 
  mutate(Smoker = case_when(Smoker == 'E' ~ 'Ex-smoker',
                            Smoker == 'Y' ~ 'Yes',
                            Smoker == 'N' ~ 'No'
                            )
         )


pca_fit |> 
  augment(pca_data) |> 
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, 
             .fittedPC2, 
             color = Smoker,
```
